trans-unit.source: MOF Documents Are Encrypted By Default
trans-unit.target: MOF Documents Are Encrypted By Default

trans-unit.source: In previous versions of DSC you were required to distribute and manage certificates in order to secure credentials within a configuration.
trans-unit.target: In previous versions of DSC you were required to distribute and manage certificates in order to secure credentials within a configuration.

trans-unit.source: For many, this was a significant management burden and even with all of the work it took to do this you were still left with some configuration information that was not and could not be secured.
trans-unit.target: For many, this was a significant management burden and even with all of the work it took to do this you were still left with some configuration information that was not and could not be secured.

trans-unit.source: That is no longer the case because **all configuration MOFs are secured by default**.
trans-unit.target: That is no longer the case because **all configuration MOFs are secured by default**.

trans-unit.source: No certificates or meta-configuration settings are needed.
trans-unit.target: No certificates or meta-configuration settings are needed.

trans-unit.source: Any time a configuration MOF is saved to disk by the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) on a target node, it is encrypted.
trans-unit.target: Any time a configuration MOF is saved to disk by the Local Configuration Manager (LCM) on a target node, it is encrypted.

trans-unit.source: **Note:** MOFs generated by a configuration script are not encrypted.
trans-unit.target: **Note:** MOFs generated by a configuration script are not encrypted.

trans-unit.source: If you are already using the certificate method for encrypting passwords or if you need additional security for your passwords, the [existing method of certificate based encryption](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/dsc/securemof) will continue to work.
trans-unit.target: If you are already using the certificate method for encrypting passwords or if you need additional security for your passwords, the [existing method of certificate based encryption](https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/dsc/securemof) will continue to work.

trans-unit.source: The result will be a MOF document that is fully encrypted using the DPAPIs and additionally have passwords encrypted within it.
trans-unit.target: The result will be a MOF document that is fully encrypted using the DPAPIs and additionally have passwords encrypted within it.

trans-unit.source: This encryption only applies to configuration MOF documents (pending.mof, current.mof, previous.mof and partial MOFs).
trans-unit.target: This encryption only applies to configuration MOF documents (pending.mof, current.mof, previous.mof and partial MOFs).

trans-unit.source: Meta-configuration MOFs are still saved in plain text since they less likely contain secrets.
trans-unit.target: Meta-configuration MOFs are still saved in plain text since they less likely contain secrets.
